attributes.action: Prescription charge to be stopped to end discrimination against people who live in England
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Sir.

I would like to raise a formal compliant. The complaint is that I am a British Citezen, English by birth, who lives in England. I and my family have to pay for our prescriptions.

Other people who live in Scotland and Wales do not pay for theirs or hospital parking. This is discrimination against subjects of the British Isles who live in England and it must stop with immediate affect.

I write this complaint to try to address the issue internally. I have also copied it to my MP Andrew Turner. I will if necessary seek court opinion.

Thank You

Mark Smout. Dip He (Ad Nsg) (Open)

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
